  • Method Details

    • getSubMessage

      public java.lang.String getSubMessage()
      Returns:
      message to be displayed on the text box

    • isOpen

      public boolean isOpen()
      Returns:
      text box is open

    • setOpen

      public void setOpen()
      Opens the text box.

    • toggleIsOpen

      public void toggleIsOpen()
      Toggles between the text box being open and closed.

    • setClosed

      public void setClosed()
      Closes the terminal and clears the stored message.

    • handleEscape

      public void handleEscape()
      Handles the escape key being pressed to close to text box.

    • nextMessage

      public void nextMessage()
      If there is a next message, it start to be displayed in the text box, if there is no more messages then the text box will be closed.

    • setSubMessage

      public void setSubMessage()
      The sub message displayed will be updated at a delay of 20ms each character. If the player has pressed a button while it is appearing, then the entire line will appear.

    • setSkip

      public void setSkip()
      When the player provides an input while the message is appearing, it sets skip to true which will display the entire message. If skip is true while it is pressed, the next messaged will be displayed.

    • addCommand

      public void addCommand​(java.lang.String name, Command command)
      Adds a command to the list of valid text box commands.
      Parameters:
      name - command name
      command - command

    • setDialogue

      public void setDialogue​(Dialogue dialogue)
      Sets the dialogue to a certain message depending on cutscene that is to be displayed.
      Parameters:
      dialogue - the sequence of strings that are to be displayed in the text box
